title: 113_s2892
content: The Act titled "401(Kids) Education Savings Account Act of 2014" eliminates income-based reduction in contributions to Coverdell Education Savings Accounts before January 1, 2015. It also increases the annual contribution limitation to the dollar amount in effect for the taxable year beginning after December 31, 2014. The Act allows home school expenses to be considered qualified education expenses for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts. This includes home schools meeting state law requirements. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. Qualified distributions from Coverdell Education Savings Accounts for first home purchases are also permitted. The amendment expands qualified expenses for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to include qualified first-time homebuyer expenses and qualified education expenses. The amendment expands qualified expenses for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to include first-time homebuyer expenses and education expenses. Definitions for terms like 'first-time homebuyer' and 'qualified acquisition costs' are consistent with section 72(t)(8) of the Internal Revenue Code. Conforming amendments are made to sections 530(b) and 530(d)(1) of the Code. The headings and clauses in various sections of the Internal Revenue Code are amended to replace "education expenses" with "qualified expenses" and expand the definition to include first-time homebuyer expenses. The amendments made by this section apply to distributions made in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014. SEC. 6. Qualified rollover contributions from Coverdell Education Savings Accounts to Roth IRAs. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for rollover contributions to Roth IRAs from eligible retirement plans and Coverdell education savings accounts, with specific requirements to be met. The amendment allows rollover contributions to Roth IRAs from eligible retirement plans and Coverdell education savings accounts, with specific requirements to be met. The effective date for these changes is for rollover contributions made in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.
